data.label: then you've come to the right space. how about a story?

connections.m25: tell me the one about the girl who disappeared.
connections.m27: tell me the one about the coyotes.

data.label:
A girl had disappeared. This made the people who knew the girl very confused. Eventually, their confusion turned to sadness. And their sadness turned to a deeper sadness. The longer the girl was disappeared for, the deeper the sadness grew, until its depth had grown so large that the people had forgotten what they were sad about

...and the girl was never spoken of again.

connections.m26: I don't think I liked that story.

data.label: What story?

Coyote Jack was near death when he saw it. A bright light on a hill.
It reached out to him in the form of a hand, and although he knew it
was only a trick of the mind, as all minds wander when they begin to
slip, he reached out his paw. But Coyote Jack's paw was no longer a
paw, it was a hand, just like the hand that was reaching toward him,
only his had six fingers, and the hand made of light had ten.
only Coyote Jack knows.
